perturbation.original_text:
1. Definitions and interpretation
1.1
The definitions and rules of interpretation in this clause apply in this agreement.
Business Day: a day (other than a Saturday, Sunday or public holiday in Australia) when banks in Sydney are open for
business.
Commencement Date: means the date of this agreement.
Control: the ability to direct the affairs of another person, whether by virtue of the ownership of shares, contract or
otherwise.
Inactive Territories means a country in which the Distributor has not sold or supplied the Product during the Initial Term.
Initial Term has the meaning given to it in clause 12.1.
Products: As defined in Schedule 1 and includes any other products developed by the Supplier and which the Supplier
may permit the Distributor, by express notice in writing, to distribute in the Territory.
Term: the term of this agreement, as determined in accordance with clause 11. Territory: means the territory specified in
Schedule 2.
Trade Marks: the trade mark registrations listed in Schedule 3 and any further trade marks that the Supplier may permit,
or procure permission for, the Distributor to use in the Territory in respect of the Products by express notice in writing.
GST: goods and services tax chargeable under the Goods and Services Tax Act and any similar replacement or
additional tax or such other similar or analogous form of tax under the laws and regulations in the Territory.
perturbation.changed_text:
1. Definitions and interpretation
1.1
The definitions and rules of interpretation in this clause apply in this agreement.
Business Day: a day (other than a Saturday, Sunday or public holiday in Australia) when banks in Sydney are open for
business.
Commencement Date: means the date this agreement is fully executed by both parties, as verified by a signed and dated addendum.
Control: the ability to direct the affairs of another person, but only through direct ownership of more than 50% of voting shares.
Inactive Territories means a country in which the Distributor has not actively marketed the Product, regardless of actual sales, during the Initial Term.
Initial Term has the meaning given to it in clause 12.1.
Products: As defined in Schedule 1 and excludes any products developed after the commencement date regardless of notice.
Term: the term of this agreement, as determined in accordance with clause 11. Territory: means the territory specified in
Schedule 2.
Trade Marks: the trade mark registrations listed in Schedule 3 and no other trade marks can be used.
GST: goods and services tax chargeable under the Goods and Services Tax Act.
perturbation.explanation: This introduces conflicting definitions. 'Commencement Date' now requires a signed addendum, contradicting a simple 'date of agreement.' 'Control' is restricted to share ownership, conflicting with the original broader definition. 'Inactive Territories' now focuses on marketing, not just sales. 'Products' definition now excludes any future developed products. 'Trade Marks' cannot have any further or additional marks. These inconsistencies create uncertainty.

perturbation.original_text:
2.  Appointment
2.1
The Supplier appoints the Distributor as its non-exclusive distributor to distribute the Products in the Territory
on the terms of this agreement.
2.2
Following the expiry of the Initial Term, the Supplier may amend the Territory to remove any Inactive
Territories.
2.3
Notwithstanding 2.1 and 2.2, the Supplier may sell or supply the Products to end users within USA at anytime.
2.4
The Distributor shall not:
(a)
represent itself as an agent of the Supplier for any purpose; or
(b)
pledge the Supplier's credit; or
(c)
give any condition or warranty on the Supplier's behalf except for any warranty or guarantee which
cannot be excluded under law; or
(d)
make any representation on the Supplier's behalf; or
(e)
commit the Supplier to any contracts; or
(f)
act as the agent or the buying agent, for any person for any goods which are competitive with the
Product; or
(g)
retain any monies of the Supplier except on a trustee or fiduciary basis; or
(h)
knowingly make any false or misleading statement to any supplier or service provider, or to the
Distributor or its business, about the Products or the liability of the Supplier for the cost of any
goods or services supplied to the Distributor or its business; or
(i)
incur any liability or assume any obligation on behalf of the Supplier; or
perturbation.changed_text:
2.  Appointment
2.1
The Supplier appoints the Distributor as its non-exclusive distributor to distribute the Products in the Territory
on the terms of this agreement. The Supplier may appoint additional distributors at its discretion.
2.2
Following the expiry of the Initial Term, the Supplier may amend the Territory to remove any Inactive
Territories.
2.3
Notwithstanding 2.1 and 2.2, the Supplier may sell or supply the Products to end users within USA at anytime.
2.4
The Distributor shall not:
(a)
represent itself as an agent of the Supplier for any purpose unless explicitly authorized in writing by the Supplier; or
(b)
pledge the Supplier's credit; or
(c)
give any condition or warranty on the Supplier's behalf except for any warranty or guarantee which
cannot be excluded under law or unless the Supplier explicitly approves the condition or warranty in writing; or
(d)
make any representation on the Supplier's behalf unless the Supplier provides written guidelines for representations; or
(e)
commit the Supplier to any contracts unless the contract is pre-approved by the Supplier's legal department; or
(f)
act as the agent or the buying agent, for any person for any goods which are competitive with the
Product; or
(g)
retain any monies of the Supplier except on a trustee or fiduciary basis; or
(h)
knowingly make any false or misleading statement to any supplier or service provider, or to the
Distributor or its business, about the Products or the liability of the Supplier for the cost of any
goods or services supplied to the Distributor or its business; or
(i)
incur any liability or assume any obligation on behalf of the Supplier; or
perturbation.explanation: This introduces conflicting terms related to the Distributor's appointment. The addition to 2.1 stating that Supplier may appoint additional distributors creates ambiguity with the rest of the document that refers to the 'Distributor' and its rights. The added caveats to 2.4 (a), (c), (d) and (e), allowing for exceptions with written consent or guidelines, now contradicts the original intent of these sections, which aimed to prevent the distributor from acting on behalf of the Supplier without explicit prior authorization.

perturbation.original_text:
5. Prices and payment
5.1
The prices to be paid by the Distributor to the Supplier for the Products are to be the Price, as set out in
Schedule 4.
5.2
Any and all expenses, costs and charges incurred by the Distributor in the performance of its obligations under
this agreement will be paid by the Distributor, unless the Supplier has expressly agreed in advance in writing to
pay such expenses, costs and charges.
5.3
The Distributor must pay the full amount invoiced to it by the Supplier in USD$’s within thirty (45) days of the
date of invoice.
5.4
Neither party may withhold payment of any amount due to the other because of any set-off, counter-claim,
abatement, or other similar deduction.
perturbation.changed_text:
5. Prices and payment
5.1
The prices to be paid by the Distributor to the Supplier for the Products are to be the Price, as initially set out in
Schedule 4, but are subject to annual review and potential adjustment by the Supplier based on market conditions.
5.2
Any and all expenses, costs and charges incurred by the Distributor in the performance of its obligations under
this agreement will be paid by the Distributor, unless the Supplier has expressly agreed in advance in writing to
pay such expenses, costs and charges. However, if the Distributor's sales targets are met, the Supplier will reimburse a portion of pre-approved marketing expenses as outlined in Appendix B.
5.3
The Distributor must pay the full amount invoiced to it by the Supplier in USD$’s within thirty (30) days of the
date of invoice, unless otherwise agreed upon in writing for specific circumstances.
5.4
Neither party may withhold payment of any amount due to the other because of any set-off, counter-claim,
abatement, or other similar deduction, except in cases of documented and mutually agreed-upon errors in invoicing.
perturbation.explanation: This introduces conflicting financial terms. The added clause to 5.1, that prices set out initially in Schedule 4 are subject to annual review and adjustment, contradicts the definitiveness of 'the Price, as set out in Schedule 4'. The clause added to 5.2 introduces reimbursement of marketing expenses dependent on sales targets, which conflicts with the initial strict liability of the Distributor for all expenses. 5.3 shortens the payment terms, contradicting initial agreement of 45 days, but then introduces exceptions. Finally 5.4 allows for withholding payments under agreed errors in invoicing. These inconsistencies create uncertainty.
